docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Fundamentals
docs.text:
• The player is weak and not made for surving the alien planet.
  • Rather than weapons the player prefers tools.

docs.title: Stungun
docs.text: Very limited amount of ammunition, to make stun-locking enemies not a viable strategy.

docs.title: Shockwire
docs.text: Inspired by Horizon: Zero Dawn a trap layed down beforehand to accomplish different kinds of effects on passing creatures.

docs.title: Barrier
docs.text: Something that creatures don't want to enter/pass through.

docs.title: Distraction
docs.text: Something to distract creatures to lead them in a certain direction.

docs.title: TP-Bridges
docs.text: The player places down two anchors. Interacting with one of them teleports the player to the other anchor. Intended use is to prepare the bridge and then use it afterwards, not place it in a rush. That is also why an anchor requires some time to be deployed.

docs.title: Flash
docs.text: Used to confuse chasing creatures that are using eyesight.

docs.title: Smoke grenade
docs.text: A hiding place, unless chasing creatures saw the player enter.

docs.title: Scout drone
docs.text: Inspired by R6 Siege, a way for the player to get some information on the area ahead without risking their own discovery.

docs.title: Movement
docs.text: Some tools that allow the player to move in more ways than just walk. Could include diegetic bars, roles, sprints and more.

docs.title: Alien abilities
docs.text: Alien specific abilities, though not every creatures can use all of these abilities.

docs.title: Charge-AOE
docs.text: Charges an area of effect ability that hits the player. Animation that displays charge to allow player to get out of reach.

docs.title: Scan
docs.text: Allows the creature to check for enemies, mainly used to find the player after they escaped.

docs.title: Silence
docs.text: Prevents player to use certain abilities for a set amount of time.

docs.title: Slimeshot
docs.text: Stuns player on hit at their current location.

docs.title: Stealth
docs.text: Hides itself to surprise player and reduce predictability. Can't hide just about everywhere.

docs.title: Change environment
docs.text: For example places cobwebs at their current location that makes it harder for the player to pass that area.

docs.title: Terrain
docs.text:
• Normal
  • Tough
  • Slippery

docs.title: Cover
docs.text:
• Natural cover (bushes)
  • Line of sight (hide behind)

docs.title: Scanner
docs.text: Displays information about the current planet.

docs.title: Skilltree
docs.text:
Skills can be earned/unlocked by in-game money to limit immersion breaking as much as possible. Therefore the player won't have a level.

  • Reduce visibility
  • Increase movement speed

docs.title: Performance based difficulty
docs.text: AI might get better during the game and adapt to the player.

docs.title: More options/brains instead of muscle
docs.text: Instead of becoming overpowered the player gets more options. The environment and obstacles still get harder though, but the main focus should be the player getting better at the game. This means no weapons that simply deal more damage.

docs.title: OnePager
docs.text: P-Tra is a Third-Person Top-Down Exploration-Game including puzzle and stealth aspects centered on a space poacher hunting for rare alien trophies and extraterrestrial loot. Roaming around space on their trusty old space ship they come across various species and landscapes. Though humanity's reputation precedes and the locals aren’t exactly fond of the unknown visitor.

docs.title: Exploration
docs.text: The many landing sites are free to explore.
